meanings.definition: In an unfair or unjust manner.
meanings.sent1: She was treated unjustly by her boss.
meanings.sent2: The decision was made unjustly and caused a lot of harm.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at me unjustly when I accidentally stepped on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The storm unjustly destroyed all the hard work we had put into the garden.
meanings.sent5: The teacher unjustly punished the entire class for one student's mistake.

meanings.sent1: The unjustly high prices made it difficult for many people to afford basic necessities.
meanings.sent2: It was an unjustly harsh punishment for such a minor offense.
meanings.sent3: The unjustly loud music from the party next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: The unjustly heavy workload left the employees feeling overwhelmed and exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The unjustly biased judge made a decision that shocked everyone in the courtroom.
